body: The configuration for `rust_analyzer` in this plugin sets up a command `CargoReload` that calls an internal function `reload_workspace`. This function had the same problem as the function of the same name in `rust-tools.nvim` (see simrat39/rust-tools.nvim#267 and simrat39/rust-tools.nvim#410). I've applied the same fix I did here as I did there.

comment_data.body: there can't use 1 index if there has two ?   get client which attach current buffer?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,13 +1,16 @@
 local util = require 'lspconfig.util'
 
-local function reload_workspace(bufnr)
-  bufnr = util.validate_bufnr(bufnr)
-  vim.lsp.buf_request(bufnr, 'rust-analyzer/reloadWorkspace', nil, function(err)
-    if err then
-      error(tostring(err))
-    end
-    vim.notify 'Cargo workspace reloaded'
-  end)
+local function reload_workspace()
+  local client = vim.lsp.get_active_clients { name = 'rust_analyzer' }
+  if #client ~= 0 then
+    vim.notify 'Reloading Cargo Workspace'
+    client[1].request('rust-analyzer/reloadWorkspace', nil, function(err)

comment_data.body: I’m using index 1 because I’m searching clients by name. It’s possible for multiple clients to attach to one buffer, but if there are multiple clients with the name `”rust_analyzer”` then something has clearly gone wrong.

> but if there are multiple clients with the name ”rust_analyzer” then something has clearly gone wrong.

maybe nope. if someone rewrite root detect for spawn two servers? Please don't use hard-coded assumptions. It's not 100% established

comment_data.body: I've updated it so it now reloads the workspace on all clients with the name `"rust_analyzer"`.

comment_data.body: this function still need bufnr. then you can use it to get the client which attach this buffer .and send  request.

comment_data.body: Updated again, now it specifies both the buffer number and the name of the client. So only a client named 'rust_analyzer' that is attached to the current buffer will be sent the RPC request.

comment_regular_data.body: Updated commit to comply with linting

title: Fix `CargoReload` sending RPC requests to unrelated LSP clients
